definition[0]: if a duty or job falls on someone, they are responsible for doing it
example[0]: The responsibility usually falls on the mother.
definition[1]: to eagerly start eating or using something
example[1]: She fell on the food as if she hadn’t eaten for days.
definition[2]: to suddenly attack or get hold of someone
example[2]: Some of the older boys fell on him and broke his glasses.
definition[3]: if your eyes etc fall on something, you notice it
example[3]: His eyes fell on her bag. ‘Are you going somewhere?’
definition[4]: to experience difficulties and problems in your life such as not having enough money
example[4]: The aim is to raise money for workers who have fallen on hard times.
definition[5]: to leave your job because your organization has done something wrong, and you are taking responsibility for it
example[5]: It was clear that the prime minister wanted her to fall on her sword.
